name: White-necked Raven
description: It has a white patch behind the neck and a white tip on its robust beak; otherwise, it is black.
food_note: Large insects, small vertebrates, carrion, fruits, seeds
image_alt: White-necked Raven, photo: Martin Smrček, Prague Zoo
proportions: Body length 35–37.5 cm; tail length 18–18.5 cm; weight 0.9–1 kg
attractions: It searches for food in trees and on the ground. When it catches a turtle, it carries it aloft like vultures and drops it onto rocks. It lives in pairs.
breeding: We have kept them since 2004; the first chicks hatched in 2008.
